newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria's atomic energy chief sacked.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria's atomic energy chief sacked.

text.p: Bulgaria's Atomic Energy Committee (BAEC) chairman Yanko Yanev said on Friday he has been fired by the Prime Minister Zhan Videnov without being given any reason.

Despite this Yanev said he would continue work for the country's nuclear safety. "I have been working in this field for five years and with my experience I hope I will be able to do my best for the country's nuclear safety," he told Reuters.
Yanev will be replaced by the member of the ruling Socialist Party's leadership in Sofia Lachezar Kostov from the Nuclear Scietific Institute.
